intro: Fagonia olivieri, commonly known as the olive tree of the genus Fagonia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Capparaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly in countries like Namibia and Botswana. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and its ability to thrive in harsh, dry environments. Its leaves are typically small and succulent, adapted to reduce water loss. Fagonia olivieri plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
